'Nuff said: Good Old Games gets Another World
4:40 PM on 03.18.2010   |   Jordan Devore
49 comments

#Digital Distribution #Good Old Games #OMG poniez! #PC

Another World -- or Out of this World, as many of you will know it by -- is now on DRM-free digital distribution service Good Old Games. It can be had for $9.99. Need I say more?

I love the game, even though I have never made it more than oh, five minutes in. It's more or less universally loved by the Destructoid staff. Not long after we got an email detailing the good news, the thread soon reached fifteen or so replies full of praise for the game.

Other, less exciting recent releases include: Empire Earth II Gold, Gabriel Knight 3, and Aquanox. Not to completely s**t on these games, but this is Another World we're talking about here.


Continue reading: More PC stories

Spectreman
* A little overpriced compared compared with other classic games in GOG. But its a fantastic game. Delphine could do a come back now, with games in that style for Live and PSN.

Ramalho
I haven't heard about this game until now.

uomoartificiale
that's a great game, and cachi is my personal idol

teriyakiCHICKEN
Ramalho: you are no true gamer.

StingingVelvet
It's the "HD" remake as well, is it not?

Space Moose
I never got far in this game either, I remember downloading a copy off of a local BBS when I was about 13 it took almost 2 days with a 14.4 modem, I think the game was just over 1 meg. /memory lane rant

JFF
timeless classic

KwikPwn
Had this for Snes, one of my favorites from back in the day.

Crawdads Revenge
Without question the BEST game that I can't stand to play. I got turned off by the unforgiving trial and error gameplay. There are a lot of good Youtube videos if you want to check it out before forking over $10.

hornetjockey
Done and done. I lost the disk to this years ago. $10 is a fair price to get it back. And Jordan, you need to finish this game. Sooo good.

hornetjockey
Also, I heard this guy was making a new game.

munkee
very stylized, HUD-less game. well worth a play if you have never tried it! I would rather play Flashback though :)

MrDom
Holy crap I remember this game like it was yesterday. The farthest I ever got in that game was busting out of a cage only to get shot by some dude with a laser gun. The death sequences were hilarious ranging from the little leech scratch of doom to being turn to dust by said laser. This game taught me a lot about insight when I was a youngin' playing this on the SNES.

Keres
This game is tooooooo good

psycho terror2
AWESOME game. every bit of progress felt like blind luck the first time through. i may well pay for this, although i already own both the SNES cart and the PC HD remake.

@ munkee

never quite got into flashback. it felt halfway between this and oddworld, but not as satisfying or competent as either.

Keres
And HOLY FUCK I never noticed that GOG has Gabriel Knight on there. brb buying

fetusmilk
i still have my SNES cart of this. just wish my SNES worked. think the power plug is broken inside. :(

Space Moose
@fetusmilk
I have a bunch laying around, you can have one if you want to pay the shipping but its probably worth more to ship than what the snes is worth

Stereocast
OMG I played the shit out of this game with my sister on my genesis, trial and errored through the whole thing. Still have it! I remember always laughing with her when your companion first taps you on the shoulder and speaks, "My tuba!" lol! wtf did he say!?!?

tsunamikitsune
I remember playing this on my 3D0 and getting eaten about 5 minutes in. I wonder if I could actually get anywhere today? :O

DarthSeaBass
Good game but flashback was always the better game imo!

Butternine
Yes! :D

Such a fun game...even if it is in a die-every-30-seconds sort of way. :)

Although I have the SNES version, I'm still picking this one up as I hear it's got some improvements.

WastelandTraveler
@Keres - yea dude, they added that during the month of activision special they had going on!

on a side note, I am still waiting for the following to show up on GOG for me to be totally <3 w/ that site:

- Battlezone 1 & 2
- Homeworld 1 & 2
- System Shock 1 & 2

Keres
@Everyone talking about the SNES version:

The PC version has far less load times and better performance overall than the SNES version. It's quite a bit better, IMO.

EricBlair
Aw man, have to give this one a shot someday. Hear a lot about it.

flynn110
oh man, this is amazing. i used to love this game when i was little. it's strange as I was actually looking around the net for this game the other day!

JQM78
wow, great memories from this one.......played it in its entirety a couple of times back in the day.......great game.

Kakihara_The_Killer
Wow, that brings me back. I too only made it past the first 5 min. the world felt so huge and intimidatingly real somehow.

MidnightOwl
Just bring Flashback to PSN and I'll be happy.

EdgyDude
@Ralmaho: Maybe you're a bit young to remember it? this is a late 80s - early 90's classic

Satsumomo
Heh, this game has been available for quite some years with HD support directly from the developers site. At least this way it will get way more exposure.

El Supremo
Sweet game. I'd buy it again, but not too long ago I did re-buy it when I knew Cahi was making a new game and selling this game with a few tweaks to play in modern PCs.

To my liking, it has one of the best endings ever. I remember it fondly.

incrediblebrendan
flashback > out of this world

great game though...

Shaka Adim
one of the best games ever!
i have the 15th aniversary edition and there is a bonus interview with eric chahi which is great! i like the part when jean-franois freitas talk about when chahi asked him to compose music to his new game. freitas asked him to show him some material from the game and the chahi responded that he already made the whole game in secret :)

jaxx
This game has been one of my favorites for years, I still go back and play it every now and then. Such a great experience, being trapped in another dimension, not knowing what the heck is going on. Dang... great game, great ideas with the laser gun shield, great animation especially for the time, those cut scenes were so awesome. damn...

Amnesiac
Awesome, I've always wanted to play it.

KaL YoshiKa
One the first true cinematic games - I guess Project Firestart is closest to the first though. Love Another World too bad about the sequel being depressing.

Opa-Opa
I beat it at least once a week. One of my favorite games and frequent inspiration. Another World is a true masterpiece.

Opa-Opa
@Shaka Adim I never heard about the bonus content! Can I find it somewhere?

kevinski
The SNES version of this game is garbage. The Genesis version easily bests it, although I prefer the HD remake. So, is it 100% confirmed that this is DRM-free? Reason being, I bought the HD remake a while back, and I seem to recall it being stated that you can only install and activate it three times. I have two left, but I'd buy this immediately if I didn't need to worry about that.

Lunarmoth
Still have it for my Sega. One of my fist games.

kevinski
Actually, I couldn't resist buying it. There are games that I just can't buy enough of. Castlevania: Symphony of the Night is one, and Out of This World (aka Another World) is another.

Nicojay2
I still have my Amiga copy of the game and box.

MechaMonkey
Oh man... I played this way back when I was but a wee lad, and have been trying to figure out what game it was ever since.

This post has solved one of the greatest mysteries of my childhood. Thank you, Destructoid.

SnatchTease
'Heart of the Alien' was at least twice as good, since it came with 'Out of this World'. Seriously, now I need to fire up my SegaCD.

EnigmaticHarle
This is one of the first PC games I've ever played and let me tell you, I hated it. Then again, I wasn't even 10 years old by then, so it was nothing compared to Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure! I'm sure it's a great game and was back then, but I never found it fun (or colourful) enough hahaha

xaliqen
Great game. I remember playing this as a kid... and dying... a LOT.

Comments policy

Destructoid is an open discussion community. You don't need to "audition" to post a comment - just speak your mind. We respect differing opinions on the site, so have at it. Be smart, funny, insightful, clueless, or cute -- but back it up with substance. Keep your cool, keep it fun. We only ask that you act respectfully and above all: don't be a troll and ruin it for everyone else. Don't bring down gamers or we'll, you know, gently shoot you in the face and stuff you into a flaming mailbox. Each comment is your opportuntity to make this community awesomer. Is that even a word?

Avoiding the banhammer only requires common sense: spamming, trolling, racism, NSFW stuff, and other forms of sucking will not be tolerated. If anyone is griefing please report abuse. Be good. Don't suck!
